sources.title: Articles on Smashing Magazine ‚Äî For Web Designers And Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we‚Äôre talking about React performance. What factors slow our React apps down, and how can we fix it? Drew McLellan talks to expert Ivan Akulov to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 38 With Ivan Akulov: Why Is My React App Slow?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Leonardo Losoviz)
articles.description: Amazon allows visitors to display prices in their own currency. Thanks to *ExchangeRatesApi.io*, we can do the same for our online shops, providing a better experience to our customers. Let‚Äôs find out how.
articles.title: Setting Up A Currency Convertor With ExchangeRatesApi.io

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: What could be a better way to welcome June than with some colorful inspiration? Well, we might have something for you: wallpapers created with love by artists and designers from across the globe.
articles.title: Happy June Vibes For Your Screen (2021 Desktop Wallpapers Edition)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Shalabh Vyas)
articles.description: In this article, we‚Äôll be re-using the foundational WYSIWYG Editor built in the first article to build a commenting system for a WYSIWYG Editor that enables users to select text inside a document and share their comments on it. Let‚Äôs dig in!
articles.title: Adding A Commenting System To A WYSIWYG Editor

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Cosima Mielke)
articles.description: Meet useful Visual Studio Code extensions for web developers: little helpers to minimize slow-downs and frustrations, and boost developer‚Äôs workflow along the way. With auto log messages, auto code formatting, file utils, file labels, code snippets, highlight brackets, tags, indents and workspaces, onboarding and remote SSH.
articles.title: Useful VS Code Extensions For Front-End Developers

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Miroslav Bekyarov)
articles.description: While web builders have been around for a long time, it wasn‚Äôt until recently that they became practical for professional use. Closing the gap between design and code has become the north star for many companies and we are seeing a wave of tools that deliver on this promise.
articles.title: How To Build And Launch Powerful Responsive Websites With Editor X

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Carie Fisher)
articles.description: Discover which SVG patterns we should avoid and which patterns are the most inclusive when comparing different combinations of OSs, browsers, and screen readers.
articles.title: Accessible SVGs: Perfect Patterns For Screen Reader Users

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Tobias G√ºnther)
articles.description: Mistakes. These cruel villains do not even stop at the beautiful world of software development. But although we cannot avoid making mistakes, we can learn to undo them! This post will show the right tools for your daily work with Git.
articles.title: A Guide To Undoing Mistakes With Git (Part 2)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Barry Pollard)
articles.description: Web fonts are often terrible for web performance and none of the font loading strategies are particularly effective to address that. Upcoming font options may finally deliver on the promise of making it easier to align fallback fonts to the final fonts.
articles.title: A New Way To Reduce Font Loading Impact: CSS Font Descriptors

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Adrian Bece)
articles.description: CSS Container queries bring media queries closer to the target elements themselves and enables them to adapt to virtually any given container or layout. In this article, we‚Äôre going to cover CSS container query basics and how to use them today with progressive enhancement or polyfills.
articles.title: CSS Container Queries: Use-Cases And Migration Strategies

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Shalabh Vyas)
articles.description: Let‚Äôs build a rich text, WYSIWYG-editor that supports rich text, images, links and some nuanced features from word processing apps. We will use SlateJS to build the shell of the editor and then add a toolbar and custom configurations.
articles.title: Building A Rich Text Editor (WYSIWYG)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Iris Lje≈°njanin)
articles.description: Front-end and design are remarkably complex these days. That‚Äôs why we invite kind, smart folks from the community to run online workshops for all of us to learn together. And we have new ones coming up, and we‚Äôd like to kindly welcome you to join in.
articles.title: Boost Your Skills Online: Smashing Workshops On Front-End And Design

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Facundo Giuliani)
articles.description: A step-by-step tutorial on adding authentication and authorization to your Next.js apps, with Auth0. We‚Äôll be using a Next.js SDK to connect our application to the Auth0 API and will create the dynamic API route for React.
articles.title: How To Implement Authentication In Next.js With Auth0

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Everything to keep in mind when designing and building a mega-dropdown, common pitfalls, hover entry/exit delays, trajectory triangle technique and SVG path exit areas.
articles.title: Frustrating Design Patterns: Mega-Dropdown Hover Menus

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Miko≈Çaj Dobrucki)
articles.description: Today, we are taking a closer look at [SVGator 3.0](https://www.svgator.com/?utm_source=article&utm_medium=smashingmag&utm_campaign=svgator3_smashing), a new major release of the popular SVG application that lets you create, edit and animate SVG files and make the best out of what SVG has to offer ‚Äî from start to finish.
articles.title: How To Create, Edit And Animate SVGs All In One Place With SVGator 3.0

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we‚Äôre talking about VisBug. What is it, and how is it different from the array of options already found in Chrome DevTools? Drew McLellan talks to its creator Adam Argyle to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 37 With Adam Argyle: What Is VisBug?

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Beau Hartshorne)
articles.description: Google‚Äôs ‚ÄúPage Experience Update‚Äù will start rolling out in June. At first, sites that meet Core Web Vitals thresholds will have a minor ranking advantage in mobile search for all browsers. Search is important to any business, and this is the story of how Beau Hartshorne and his team at Instant Domain Search improved their Core Web Vitals scores.
articles.title: How We Improved Our Core Web Vitals (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (√Åtila Fassina)
articles.description: ‚ÄúTree-shaking‚Äù is a must-have performance optimization when bundling JavaScript. In this article, we dive deeper on how exactly it works and how specs and practice intertwine to make bundles leaner and more performant. Plus, you‚Äôll get a tree-shaking checklist to use for your projects.
articles.title: Tree-Shaking: A Reference Guide

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: In this new series of articles on UX, we take a closer look at some frustrating design patterns and explore better alternatives, along with plenty of examples to keep in mind when building or designing one. Let‚Äôs start with an infamous birthday picker.
articles.title: Frustrating Design Patterns That Need Fixing: Birthday Picker

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Vitaly Friedman)
articles.description: Today marks the day we sent out our 300th edition of the Smashing Newsletter. This article is a little celebration in which we share little Smashing stories from people working behind the scenes.
articles.title: Little Smashing Stories

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Stephanie Eckles)
articles.description: A prototype of the long-awaited CSS container queries has landed in Chrome Canary and is available for experimentation. Let‚Äôs look at what problem is being solved, learn how container queries work, and see how they compare with and complement existing CSS features for layout.
articles.title: A Primer On CSS Container Queries

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Amanda Annandale)
articles.description: At the beginning of 2020, the SmashingConf team was ready for a new year. We had so many things that excited us. New speakers, new workshops, new cities, new attendees, new experiences. And as we all know, 2020 had other ideas. With so many people working from home, we thought we would bring our [Smashing workshops](https://smashingconf.com/online-workshops/) from our home offices to yours ‚Äî but how?
articles.title: The Conference Platform We Use For Our Online Events: Hopin

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Jhey Tompkins)
articles.description: Want to get started with React but struggling to find a good place to start? This article should have you covered. We‚Äôll focus on some of the main concepts of React and then we‚Äôll be building a game from scratch!
articles.title: Get Started With React By Building A Whac-A-Mole Game

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Valeriia Panina)
articles.description: How do you organize your Google Drive assets? How do you name your Dropbox Paper documents? How do you deal with comments? Let‚Äôs get it right.
articles.title: How To Organize Product-Related Assets And Collaborate Better

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Carson Shold)
articles.description: When dealing with themes for large platforms and CMS, legacy issues often become a bottleneck. In this article, Carson Shold discusses how his team improved the performance and organization of their Shopify themes, and improved maintainability along the way.
articles.title: Improving The Performance Of Shopify Themes (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Liran Cohen)
articles.description: This article showcases a case study of Bookaway‚Äôs landing page performance. We‚Äôll see how taking care of the props we send to Next.js pages can make loading times and Web Vitals better.
articles.title: Reducing HTML Payload With Next.js (Case Study)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Tobias G√ºnther)
articles.description: No matter how experienced you are, mistakes are an inevitable part of software development. But we can learn to repair them! And this is what we'll be looking at in this two-part series: how to undo mistakes using Git.
articles.title: A Guide To Undoing Mistakes With Git (Part 1)

articles.author: hello@smashingmagazine.com (Drew McLellan)
articles.description: In this episode, we‚Äôre starting our new season of the Smashing Podcast with a look at the future of CSS. What new specs will be landing in browsers soon? Drew McLellan talks to expert Miriam Suzanne to find out.
articles.title: Smashing Podcast Episode 36 With Miriam Suzanne: What Is The Future Of CSS?

articles.description: Let's build an AI model that speaks just like your favorite character and deploy that model as a Discord chatbot. All the coding and deployment happen in the cloud (for free!), so you don't even need a local IDE to follow along.
articles.title: How to Build a Discord AI Chatbot that Talks Like Your Favorite Character

articles.description: A Pandas dataframe is a two dimensional data structure which allows you to store data in rows and columns. It's very useful when you're analyzing data.  When you have a list of data records in a dataframe, you may need to drop a specific list of rows depending on the
articles.title: Data Analytics with Pandas ‚Äì How to Drop a List of Rows from a Pandas Dataframe

articles.description: Next.js makes developing React applications simpler. It provides a common structure that allows you to build frontend React applications, and transparently handles server-side rendering for you. We just released a full course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will teach you the basics of Next.js.  Kapehe developed
articles.title: Learn Next.js and Make React Development Simpler

articles.description: Hey everyone, my name is Santosh. In this article, I will tell you how I ramped up my career and ended up increasing my salary as a developer.  I'll share what I learned from each job along the way, how you can stand out, tips for negotiating salary, and how
articles.title: My Developer Journey ‚Äì How I Got a Remote Job and Increased My Salary While Contributing to Open Source

articles.description: This informative tutorial goes deep into how to get a cybersecurity job, with insights from senior leaders and hiring managers in the field.
articles.title: How to Get a Cybersecurity Job in 2021

articles.description: When you're debating someone, you want to use all the resources at your disposal to convince them you're right. But you should be careful that you don't end up using a logical fallacy to help you make your point. What is a Logical Fallacy?A logical fallacy is an error
articles.title: Logical Fallacies ‚Äì Definition and Fallacy Examples

articles.description: If you've been following the news lately, you may have noticed a worrisome tech trend. The frequency and severity of cybersecurity attacks are exploding.  We've seen news of a sprawling hack involving the SolarWinds management platform. That attack may have compromised the systems of over 18,000 SolarWinds customers.  Then,
articles.title: How to Secure Your Android App ‚Äì Four Security Best Practices Every Android Dev Should Know

articles.description: More and more applications are using computer vision these days. We just published a full course on the freeCodeCamp.org YouTube channel that will help you learn advanced computer vision using Python. You will learn state of the art computer vision techniques by building five projects with libraries such as
articles.title: Advanced Computer Vision with Python

articles.description: When you're training a machine learning model, you can have some features in your dataset that represent categorical values. Categorical features are types of data that you can divide into groups. There are three common categorical data types: Ordinal ‚Äì a set of values in ascending or descending order. Example: rating
articles.title: How to Improve Machine Learning Model Performance by Combining Categorical Features

articles.description: In this article, I'll teach you how to make a basketball using materials and textures in Unity. You can extend this micro-concept to create any kind of ball like a football, tennis ball, or snooker balls.  That said, these techniques aren't just limited to creating round 3D objects like balls.
articles.title: How to Make a Bouncing Basketball in Unity with Materials and Textures üèÄ
